snippet: The Democrats, in an increasingly testy battle for the presidential nomination, took part in a town-hall meeting in New Hampshire, where next week’s primary voting has gained in prominence after a close contest in Iowa.
abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton and Bernie Sanders spar over meaning of progressivism in CNN-hosted town hall meeting held less than week before New Hampshire primary; Clinton seeks to defend herself against Sanders's attacks on her progressive credentials.

byline.contributor: Amy Chozick contributed reporting from Derry, N.H.

lead_paragraph: The Democrats, in an increasingly testy battle for the presidential nomination, took part in a town-hall meeting in New Hampshire, where next week’s primary voting has gained in prominence after a close contest in Iowa.

headline.main: Democrats Tangle in New Hampshire Over Rights to ‘Progressive’ Label
headline.print_headline: Democrats Tangle in New Hampshire Over Rights to ‘Progressive’ Label
